name: El Rey Moro Hotel Boutique

reviews.text: We had booked in for two nights at this central hotel. Unfortunately on the first night, my wife had her handbag stolen from outside a nearby bar - (Teresas) including passport, mobile phone etc. All the reception staff showed concern and were very happy to help us, letting us use their phone for emergency calls and directing us to the police station and finding out train times to Malaga (to see British consul). It was also great that the hotel has a PC with free wi-fi access which allowed us to book new travel arrangements and print off boarding passes.
reviews.title: Very helpful at a stressful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself has lots of character. Our room (casa 1) was probably one of the more basic and a little noisy on the ground floor. However it was clean and pleasant enough. Breakfast was very adequate with a good selection of breads, fruit juices and with cooked sausage, egg and bacon if you wanted it. The location a few minutes from the Cathedral and Alcazaba was excellent too.
reviews.title: a hotel where all the staff are most helpful and the location is superb

reviews.text: I would definitely use this hotel again, but another time would willingly pay a few euros more for a better room.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October. We had to move to a different room for the second night but we were aware of this fact when we made our booking. The staff moved our belongings for us. The first room ( 24 I think ) was really small but beautifully appointed. The little sitting area outside each room is nice as it looks down on the very attractive courtyard. The staff were really helpful and when I pointed out things that were not working properly they were fixed immediately. The location is wonderful and the area is very atmospheric. i thought the breakfast was below standard.
reviews.title: Beautiful
Peaceful retreat in the heart of Barrio Santa Cruz
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my short stay at el Rey Moro. The hotel is really nice, breakfast was great, and the room (although small according to US standards) was quite nice. I had a little trouble finding it, but the streets in Seville can be kinda confusing. And, once I found it and had no trouble finding it again while I was in Seville. Also, the staff was very helpful with printing up some e-tickets for me, which was much appreciated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed four nights at El Rey Moro. The hotel was in a very convenient location to visit the sights of Seville, and just steps away from restaurants and shops. Extremely helpful and friendly staff, breakfast in a peaceful and lovely courtyard, and a very comfortable and nicely appointed room. The weather was still warm so we appreciated the complementary water and relaxing in the central courtyard. We had wine and olives several nights and the front desk were helpful with glasses and opener from the restaurant. We would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect boutique hotel in central Seville!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we really liked this hotel and would stay here again without a thought.
reviews.title: Quaint and quiet
Perfect boutique hotel in Seville
reviews.text: Liked:
Charming boutique hotel. Ambience was very quaint and romantic.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very quiet.
reviews.title: One of our favourite hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This gem of a hotel deserves all the accolades they get here. It is ideally located from a tourist's point of view, immaculate, beautiful, reliable wifi as well as guest computer with printer and free water a nice added touch. We also had a lovely time relaxing in their rooftop jaccuzi in between tapas hunting. Friendly English speaking reception staff.
reviews.title: You cannot ask for more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! It was nestled away in one of the many little lanes catacombing through the city (difficult to find at first, but don't be put out as that is Seville all round!) Beautiful little boutique rooms, clean and tidy. Up on the roof was a hot tub (we didn't use, but did go up to visit.) The staff were friendly and very helpful. Tapas looked delicious, but we didn't actually sample any (we generally don't stay in our hotels when we go away.) All in all, I think it is a fab little hotel (not the cheapest) and I would recommend to any friend or family going to Seville. Good job El Ray Moro Hotel Boutique.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in the Centre of Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can walk to all the Seville main attractions from here. It's also surrounded by lots of fabulous restaurants and tapas bars. The hotel itself is beautiful, very peaceful. Staff are really helpful and friendly. Couldn't ask for more.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous place to stay in Seville - really central, absolutely beautiful courtyard, great rooms, brilliant service. We have just had our second stay there and if (actually I should say when - because it's a wonderful, friendly, intersting, beautiful, buzzy city) we return to Seville we won't do so unless El Rey Moro has a vacancy for us!
reviews.title: Ticks every box and then some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently traveled for 30 days in both Spain and Italy. We had the pleasure to spend 2 nights at the El Rey Moro September 11 and 12 and we wished we could have stayed longer! This is one of the finest small hotels we stayed at in our travels. This hotel is recommended by both Rick Steves and Trpadvisor and it is a true gem. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. Their breakfasts were the best with a great variety including eggs made to order! The lcoation is very central, on a quiet street, walking distance from the bus station and very close to the Cathedral and great restuarants. The rooms are very clean, plush bedding, great shower and comfortable bed. I highly recommend this and will happliy stay here again!
reviews.title: Fantastic Boutique hotel at a great price

reviews.text: This is an absolutely wonderful hotel in the heart of old Seville. The central courtyard is beautifully done and the rooms are splendidly decorated. Walking the very narrow medieval streets is a delight and a huge bonus if you are sightseeing in and around the cathedral and Alcazar. But therein also lies the hotel's drawback (hence one star missing from this rating): if you are travelling by car there is no way you can get your vehicle anywhere near the hotel's entrance. (In many places you can touch opposite walls simultaneously in the alley where the entrance is.)The nearest car park is an expensive 20 euros per day and a goodly stretch to walk to and from with a heavy suitcase along cobbled streets and uneven flagstones. Even the nearest point at which cars are allowed, but are not allowed to park, is a fair distance for the elderly or infirm. Having said that, this is a delightful place with very friendly staff.
reviews.title: But no cars and no parking!

reviews.text: My teenage nephew and I stayed at the El Rey Moro for three nights in September 2012. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, in particular the staff. Each one was helpful and went out of their way to assist us. It was like having a personal assistant. Our room, number 18, is a junior suite and is one of the most charming, best-decorated rooms that I have ever stayed in. Also, it was quite large and the fold-out couch was, I hear, fairly comfortable. There is no way I will be able to get my nephew to try out a youth hostel after this experience. With the assistance of the staff we took a side trip to Ronda and arranged our transportation to Granada. The hotel itself is beautiful but what I will remember most is the fantastic staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in Sevilla, top notch staff

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights. The room was very nice and the courtyard is beautiful. Staff was very helpful and will assist in making reservations for flamenco, etc. Great location with views of the Giralda from the roof at night. Many restaurants nearby. Breakfast was so-so, with a limited selection.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel due to past reviews and we weren't disappointed. We travelled from the airport via airport bus which was directly outside of the airport and 2euros 40 one way ticket to Seville Prado de San Francesco 30 minute trip. From here you go directly across the road, though a park, over the square and down two little streets approx 5 minute walk. Pick up the bus on the way back to airport on opposite side to drop off (bus EA).
reviews.title: Brilliant short stay

reviews.text: The hotel was romantic and friendly. Our bedroom was clean, good size, powerful shower, most comfortable bed ever - think it had memory foam layer and extra blankets and pillows available. The aircon was silent so you could have it on all night. Black out liner on the curtains was a plus for me. You could book the hottub on the roof for 45 minutes private time which was great after a days sight seeing and tired feet! You can also see the top of the cathedral from here. They had free water available/wifi/bikes and segways for hire. you don't really need these however as you can walk to all the popular sights - cathedral and alcazar 2 minutes, plaza de espana 20 minutes. We got a horse and cart ride round seville for 50 euros and saw a flamenco show for 60 euros (2 people) the hotel booked this for us. Food - lots of tapas but also italian.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location

description: El Rey Moro Hotel, singular home
